proof:
Proof. Here, $k > 0$ will be a sufficiently large constant we specify later.
Fix $1 \le s < \log n$. We union bound over connected trees of size $s$ and events "$T$ is a subtree of $G$ with $e(V(T)) > s - 1 + k$". Fix any tree $T$ of size $s$. Then note that conditional on $T$ being a subgraph of $G$, we have that $e(V(T)) \sim s - 1 + \text{Bin}(\binom{s}{2} - (s - 1), d/n) \le s + \text{Bin}(s^2, d/n)$.
We have $\text{P}(\text{Bin}(s^2,d/n) \ge k) \le s^{2k}(d/n)^k$ by union bound. Lemma 31 gives that the expected number of connected trees of size $s$ is at most $n(ed)^s$, thus expected number of subtrees $T$ of $G$ of size $s$ and $> s - 1 + k$ edges between vertices of $T$ is at most
$$ \left(\frac{ds^2}{n}\right)^k n(ed)^s = n \exp\{s \log(ed) + k\log(\frac{ds^2}{n})\} < d^k n\exp\{\log(ed) \log n - k \log(\frac{n}{\log^2 n})\} $$
For $k > \log(ed) + 2$ and all $n$ large enough, this is $\le \frac{d^k}{n}$. Then union bound over $\log n$ possible sizes and then using Markov inequality gives probability $\le \log n/\sqrt{n} = o(1)$.
